items.title: Scala Machine Learning Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=22, ruby=0, apple=0, java=29, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Scala Machine Learning Engineer


Findify


We are looking for Scala ML engineers to help us build and maintain our machine learning platform. At Findify, we make extensive use of data-collection, processing and machine learning algorithms to help our merchants provide better search and recommendations to their customers. You would be responsible for building and improving our machine learning algorithms to help us achieve this goal.

Our tech stack:

We always strive to use the most suitable tool for the job, so our stack is constantly evolving. Currently, our backend is written mostly in Scala and Node.js. We use Scala for data processing and to power our machine learning algorithms. Node is used as a web framework to facilitate the interaction with our customers via various APIs. We make extensive use of AWS, and use any component we find suitable within our architecture, so we can focus on building our proprietary tech.

We’re not afraid to challenge our choices, we love open source and above all, we’re a product driven company so technology is at the core of everything we do. You can check out our full stack on StackShare.

Our development culture:

We are a small team that moves fast and iterates. We run weekly sprints, code reviews, testing, and once your code is submitted it gets pushed to production through our continuous deployment infrastructure (Jenkins). We put a lot of emphasis on code style, cleanliness and robustness. You will get to work with amazing engineers specializing in machine learning and distributed systems.

What you can expect from us:

You’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on the product, company vision and culture. You will get to work with the latest technologies out there, without being bound to any legacy. We will never limit your creativity, never shut down ideas before testing them with customers and we will never be boring! it's going to be an exciting ride!

If this sounds like a company you’d love be a part of building, and you’ve got the skill set, please get in touch with us!

We’d love to hear from you!

Skills and requirements

What we're looking for:

The most important thing we are looking for in a candidate is proven passion for programming and problem solving: a Github/Stackoverflow account, an interesting project you can share, or a blog you write will go a long way.

We are a distributed team, so you can work from anywhere you want, as long as it's 2 hours +/- from CET. (The timezone is an important requirement for us at this stage). Located in Dublin? A huge plus.

It’s really important to us that you have the ability to adapt to the company’s work processes using the agile-scrum methodology, and using tools such as Jira and Slack. Not only because of our remote working culture, but even more so because of this, you need to be really awesome at communicating, and to be organized and self-driven.

Oh, and you need to want to have fun :)

Your responsibilities:


* Improve the search relevancy and recommendation quality for our 1500 merchants, while keeping an eye on recent academic research in this field.

* Implement new ML algorithms and improving old ones to make the Findify search and recommendations quality better.

* Setup the data processing pipelines to feed these ML algorithms




The basics:


* Experience building complete ML solutions: source data collection, feature engineering and model training.

* 2+ years of professional experience with Scala. The candidate should be able to work on the full development cycle of an application, from designing a system, to validate by the code the possible assumptions and maintain/improve an existing system.

* 5+ years of general developer experience. Experience in design and development of backend systems without major external supervision. We are looking for a candidate that can be autonomous and own their projects.

* Computer Science education. We use a lot of cool algorithms in the Findify backend code, we really care about O(N*logN).




Beyond the basics:


* NoSQL: experience with Cassandra/Kafka

* DevOps: experience with AWS, Kubernetes, Docker

* Scala: akka, akka-stream, akka-http, cats


See more jobs at Findify

items.title: Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead*
Generalist with can-do attitude required to join an exciting early stage startup building wearable technology to disrupt the events space.

Do you like integrating technologies that link the world together? Do you dream about real-world experience building large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment?

We’re looking for a UK-based very hands-on Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead to join and help manage our 100% remote team and evolve our product.

*Role Requirements*
Good fundamental Computer Science knowledge (graph theory, matrix operations, etc)
Comfortable wearing Research, Development, and Operations hats in parallel
Architecting and building modern scalable mobile, front and back end environments
Familiarity with operational concerns (engineering-for-failure, scalability, performance)
Building systems in a mix of languages
Operating almost 100% remotely
Working with a 100% remote team across a variety of cultures and timezones
Excellent written and oral skills in both technical and colloquial English

*Desired Technical Skills*
Experience of using Bluetooth / BLE networking technologies (e.g. iBeacon, Eddystone, etc)
Experience using hosted systems like AWS and Heroku
Good Python ability (e.g. Jupyter, Numpy, Pandas) for basic matrix operations and data analysis
Good understanding of data analytics, methods, and tooling for real-time report generation
Good Node.js ability (e.g. building APIs)
Document oriented databases (ideally Mongo)
Understanding how to package an embedded mobile SDK and the support ecosystem that goes with it

*Optional Technical Skills*
Good understanding of mobile application development & deployment systems
Real-world understanding of modern message passing architectures and brokers (AMQP)
Orchestration & deployment of production / development environments to multiple cloud platforms
Cybersecurity, privacy and compliance, and infrastructure resiliency

*Distinct Advantages*
Experience with Machine Learning techniques
Knowledge of Graph Database technologies
Experience successfully working with remote teams

*Culture and Personality*
Commitment to others within a cohesive team
Solution-focused, consultative and comfortable working in a fluid environment
Curious and eager to pick up new technologies and languages quickly
Enjoys solving complex problems through creative thinking
Very comfortable working in a flexible, output-driven culture
Self-directed, nimble and proactive - constantly connecting dots and thinking of the next step
Thrives in a diverse, dynamic, and collaborative team
Able and willing to challenge thinking across all levels of the business
Loves to document


*About Hiver*
Hiver is a tech startup using wearable technology to help event marketers measure and improve engagement at their events by enabling event attendees to remember every contact they meet and quickly connect with those they find valuable. It connects the physical with the digital networking experience through intelligent technology. Hiver has been featured Forbes and The Financial Times and has also won Best New Event Tech by Exhibition News.

If you’re interested, send a note to hello@hivertech.com with your LinkedIn profile/CV with the subject line “Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead”

No agencies, please.

items.title: Data Analyst & Dashboard Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
*SOLVING THE PROBLEM OF FOOD WASTE*

OLIO is the world’s only neighbour-to-neighbour food sharing app, and our mission is to solve the problem of food waste in the home & local community. We do this by connecting anyone with spare food – which can be households or local businesses – with neighbours living nearby who would like it. Globally, over one third of all the food we produce gets thrown away, which is worth over $1 trillion. What few people realise however is that in the developed world, over half of all food waste takes place in the home, with the average UK family throwing away £800 of food each year - collectively adding up to £15bn. OLIO solves this with our award-winning mobile & web apps. Over the past 2 years OLIO has grown from a local initiative in North London to a global movement.

We now have over 465,000 users who have together shared well over half a million portions of food – with food being successfully shared in 32 countries and counting. Underpinning this incredible growth has been our volunteer programme, with over 19,000 people reaching out to spread the word about OLIO in their local community and rescue unsold food.

OLIO is now looking to grow our core team as we embark upon the next exciting phase in our journey.

*JOIN OUR TEAM!*

In order to accelerate OLIO to its next level in growth and impact, we are recruiting for a Data Analyst & Dashboard Developer, who will report into Viv Taylor, Product Manager.

In this role you will be responsible for:

* Data Analysis: Analysing key business questions in our burgeoning data via an SQL interface (both through
GUI and command line tools)
* Data Visualization: Development of a “data dashboard” for the company to help us interrogate our data
visually and in a user friendly manner
* Data Innovation: Liaison with our broader OLIO team to ensure that the right questions are being asked of
our growing datasets, in the right order.
* Data Exploration: Evaluation of the effects of specific initiatives/experiments at OLIO, generating and
presenting reports of their efficacy
* Setup of regular reports that provide insight into ongoing company/departmental performance.
* Assisting with online ad creative endeavours, their implementation and analysing their impact

Once you have proven yourself you will have great freedom and autonomy, coupled with an enormous opportunity for personal development. All of our roles are remote working roles, however for London based team members
there is the ability to co-work as well. We live for our mission, but like to have fun along the way!

*IS THIS YOU?*

Our ideal candidate will first and foremost be as passionate about our mission as we are! In addition to this, you will have the following experience and skills:

* Significant prior experience with SQL and RDBMS.
* Experience with Web Development and Visualization Tools, preferably with experience of relevant
JavaScript libraries (such as D3, jQuery, Bootstrap) and knowledge web models (e.g. LAMP)
* Experience of image processing software (e.g. Photoshop/GIMP)
* Excitement about Productivity Tools and Data Science.
* Curiosity about and enthusiasm for systems and processes
* Scrappy and resourceful when facing challenges of all types
* An eye for detail

*Bonus points:*

* You have experience working for a high-growth startup
And all OLIO team members share these attributes:
* A self-starter with a ‘can-do’ attitude
* Resourceful and creative
* Thorough, but able to move quickly and decisively
* A ruthless ability to prioritise
* Excellent communication skills
* Fun to work with :)

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=20, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=18, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Backend Software Engineer


Smartbnb

Smartbnb is a bootstrapped company whose core product currently helps short-term rental businesses manage and automate over 60,000 properties. We are a growing team of 6 people with plans to expand rapidly by the end of 2018.

With multiple new product launches on the horizon and several more planned before the end of the year, you will be joining the company at a time of explosive growth. Your presence will have a very real impact on the company’s value.

We are looking for a **Backend Web Developer** to join our tech team’s efforts to **supercharge our PHP web application**. You will be working directly with Pierre-Camille, our founder, who developed the original product from scratch, as well as with all members of the tech, marketing, and success teams.

Our company is fully distributed and remote. We believe and fully embrace that your best environment is wherever you - personally - feel the most productive and comfortable for day-to-day work. Nevertheless, we organise frequent meetups and retreats for the team to physically meet throughout the year. The last two trips were to Lisbon/Cascais and Paris!

 

**⭐️ What you will do: ⭐️**

• You will be an **architect**: planning structural masterpieces, laying foundations, building pillars, and reinforcing walls. Maybe a statue here and there...

• You will be **in charge of drastically improving** multiple features for our web app, helping to developing new product lines, as well as improving and maintaining the quality of the entire codebase.

• You will be **a leader in performance** (logic optimisation, indexes, queries, caching), **security** (discovering and plugging vulnerabilities), and **code health** (refactoring, unit and integration testing).

• You will **take charge of your own work** and proactively suggest improvements across the whole backend.

• In a remote environment you will be **responsible for your own time and results** – there will be no babysitting.

 

**✅ What you will need to succeed: ✅**

• **Nutcracker**: you love solving engineering problems.

• **Independent**: you are self-motivated, take initiative, and are a strong communicator. You are results-driven and willing to learn and improve yourself.

• **Technical Ninja**: proficiency with PHP 7.0+, Laravel 5.2+, MySQL, Git, beanstalkd, and Memcached and/or Redis, backed by 5+ years of Backend development experience.

• **Design Pattern Jedi**: great knowledge of and direct experience with multiple design patterns. You have written superbly abstracted code and accompanying unit tests from scratch. You have also refactored legacy, non-testable code into something less apocalyptic.

• **Caring Developer**: you recognise that your code and work impact not only the customers but also the rest of the team. You conduct yourself with professionalism and respect not only in meetings but also in how you structure your code and in the documentation that you write.

• **Superb English fluency**: we are an international team and clear communication is vital. It goes without saying (but we’ll say it anyway) that you absolutely must have the ability to participate in frequent video meetings.

• The product team is based in Europe, so at the moment we are looking for developers who are based within the same general time zones (UTC±3).

 

** Brownie points: **

• You have experience with Continuous Integration using Travis, Circle, Gitlab, or Bitbucket.

• Interactive Git rebasing doesn’t sound like voodoo to you.

• You’ve used in Git commit messages.

• You have experience with Machine Learning either with off-the-shelf tools like Dialog Flow or - better yet - more low level using tools and platforms like Theano, Torch, and Google/AWS/Microsoft/IBM ML stacks.

• You’ve built a Node.JS backend or API.

• You see past the glossy veneer of the ‘microservices’ buzzword and know when and how to build them.

**(Let us know how many you deserve.)**

 

** What we offer: **

• Competitive salary, including the possibility of stock options.

• Ample paid leave, in addition to maternity and paternity leave.

• A great support structure: we are here for you.

• Flexible contract. You will work independently where you are most productive and happiest, with flexible weekday hours.

• All the resources and tools that you need to succeed

• Join a fast-growing startup and be part of the force that shapes the company in the years to come!

 

We are solving global short-term rental automation. **Are you in?**

See more jobs at Smartbnb

Visit Smartbnb's website

items.content:
Back End Engineer


X-mode Social

 verified
X-Mode provides real-time location data and technologies that power location intelligence for advertising and business decisions in financial services, healthcare, high-tech, real-estate, retail, and the public sector. X-Mode's flagship product is a fast-growing big data location platform, which maps daily the precise routes of 10% of the U.S. Population and maps monthly 1 in 3 adult U.S. smartphone users. X-Mode strives to produce and monetize the world’s largest location platform and ultimately create a global “living map” of 1 billion people with the highest quality location data in order to fuel the best location intelligence business solutions.

X-Mode Social, Inc. is looking for a full time back-end developer to work on X-Mode's data platform and join our rapidly growing team. For this position, you can either work remotely OR in our Sterling, VA Headquarters.



REQUIREMENTS:


* Scala experience

* Experience working with very large databases and batch processing datasets with hundreds of millions of records

* Four years working with SQL and relational databases

* Four years Linux experience

* Two years working with cloud services, ideally in AWS

* Self-motivated learner / self-teaching

* Self-starter who can maintain a team-centered outlook

* Experience with Hadoop ecosystem, e.g. Spark, Hive, or Presto/Athena

* Real-time streaming with Kinesis, Kafka or similar libraries






DESIRABLE


* Python

* Machine Learning

* Elasticsearch or Solr

* GIS/Geospatial tools/analysis






Our technical staff is scattered across the U.S, so you'll need to be comfortable working remotely. We often use Phone, Google Hangouts and UberConference to coordinate, as well as Basecamp, Jira and Trello for tasking, and bit bucket for source control.

We work in short sprints, and we'll count on you to provide estimates for tasks to be completed and delivered.We're looking to hire someone to start right away! Think you've got what it takes? Apply below and feel free to email hiring@xmodesocial.com if you have any questions.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=19, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=49, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Data Scientist


Proemion


Join a well-established (30+ years) telematics company to deliver a new generation of our data processing pipeline and analytics tools.

Proemion is at the forefront of the IoT/Telematics revolution and is looking for a Data Scientist (f/m) at the earliest possible date. The position can be at our headquarter in Fulda, Germany or full-time remote.

The team you will join is mostly remote with members spread across the globe.

Requirements


* Bachelors' or Masters' degree in Physics, Math, Computer Science, or Statistics preferred

* Strong Python skills, especially in:




numby

pandas

matplotlib

statsmodels

sklearn


* You have an excellent understanding of math mainly linear algebra, probability, statistics as well as algorithms from the time series field

* You are highly experienced with tooling like git, github, docker, rundeck, Jenkins, Travis, or Bash

* Possess initiative, creativity, analytical skills, team spirit and the ability to work independently

* You are a real world coding expert




What you can expect

We are working with a massive dataset based on thousands complex construction- and off-road vehicles. Our data covers performance data, geo data and diagnostic event data. There for we have a huge range of use cases to address and can verify them utilizing out close relations with world class vehicle / machine manufacturers. We work with real machines with strong cases.

Your role will mainly include the following tasks:


* Time Series forecasting on sensor data:




ARIMA, HoldWinters, Linear Regression

Cross metric ML models


* Anomaly detection in time series data and event data

* Predictive maintenance based on performance data and diagnostic events

Windfall Data | Lead Data Scientist, Data Engineer | SF | Full Time | ONSITE or REMOTE (US-based only)

At Windfall, our goal is to determine the net worth of every person in the world.Its a super hard problem with broad applications. We work with hundreds of non-profit organizations across the US to help them better understand and engage their donors. We also work with for-profit companies in a wide array of industries (finance, travel, hospitality & gaming, luxury goods, etc) to help them better understand their clientele and targeting affluent households for net-new acquisition.

Our team is still fairly small so every new hire will have the ability to make a huge impact!

We're looking for:

* An experienced data scientist to lead our team in developing our predictive models. Data and data science are core to our business, so this role will be incredibly influential in the success of the company.

Roles are onsite in SF, or remote for the right candidate with prior remote work experience.

If you're interested in hearing more, send a message to cory@windfalldata.com

items.title: Data Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
The company

Prolific (www.prolific.ac) brings people together to power the world’s research. It is the first scientific, highly scalable, ethical participant recruitment platform for researchers around the world. Quantitative and qualitative researchers, data scientists, and entrepreneurs all need valid and reliable data sources to make predictions about human behaviour, social change, and global developments. Thanks to our online platform, researchers collect responses fast and participants earn cash rewards for themselves or for charity. It takes 5 minutes to start data collection, there's no middleman, and the product easily integrates with any survey software. In a world of unreliable results, Prolific makes data trustworthy and connects the public with science.

The role

In this role you will develop and implement data analyses, data collection systems, and other strategies that help us better understand user behaviour as well as our business and product performance. You will be analysing data using statistical techniques with a focus on understanding our growth engine, users’ full life cycle, data quality, and user demographics (for representative sampling): How does Prolific currently acquire, convert, and retain its users (both Researchers and Participants)? And what can be done to improve user acquisition, conversion, and retention? What are the current demographics of the pool, and what differences are there to the general population? Which participants are the most honest and engaged, and which are not?

You will have an opportunity to learn about the startup ecosystem, about the lean startup approach, and about user acquisition techniques and growth strategies. More broadly, you will get the chance to learn about business and product development, data science, and diverse research areas in the social and natural sciences.

This is your chance to get involved in a fast-moving startup where you’ll have huge influence over the trajectory of the product. Since it’s a startup, you’ll have the opportunity to suggest how you can best add value, and make any recommendations about improving the processes and product. We're a fast-growing company and we want to help you grow with us.

Working closely with our analysis team, developers and leadership you will work towards these key goals:

Analyse what drives the growth of our platform and what is the best allocation of resources in order to improve this growth
Improve the quality, the honesty, and engagement of Prolific’s participant pool through analysis of user behaviour and collection of new data
Improve the diversity and representativeness of Prolific’s participant pool by ongoing monitoring of demographics
This will likely involve some or all of the following:

Analyse key growth metrics, retention, stickiness, churn over time and determine causal links between product changes and growth. Work closely with management and use these data to influence key decisions and help our startup grow quickly
Use analytics software such as Amplitude to create visualisations, segment our user base, and develop dashboards to track key growth, data quality, and demographic metrics over time
Develop a clear understanding of our community and intersect this qualitative data with quantitative data and develop a plan of key questions to answer with data
Extract data from non-SQL/SQL databases for analyses in a reproducible way for downstream analysis or work closely with developers in order to achieve this
Statistically analyse large data sets (millions of rows) and draw robust conclusions from these data with the understanding that large data sets are messy, and it is easy to draw incorrect conclusions from these data if our analyses are not robust
Develop attention checks, consistency checks and longitudinal measures designed to track participants’ consistency, honesty, and engagement
Proactively suggest new questions to ask, new data to collect, or product changes to make based on insights from data
Generate regular reports in a reproducible manner which clearly and accurately describe the collection, organisation, and analysis of your data
Disseminate the key information to the whole organisation in written reports and summaries, which highlight the key insights you’ve gained and which are easily interpretable and actionable
Benefits

Salary: £28,000-32,000 (p.a.), negotiable based on experience and qualifications, plus:
Pension (employer contribution 3% of base salary)
Flexible working: Work equipment of your choice, you can work flexibly from home or from our coworking space, flexible hours
25 days holiday per year, plus bank holidays
Flexible budget for any books and/or educational material
Personal growth opportunities (e.g., learn about the startup ecosystem, mentoring from executive team, learn about psychological science and research methods)
Open, transparent, and inclusive culture
Self-made cider and home-baked cookies :-)
How we interview & hire

Our hiring process usually begins with an introductory online interview to help you get to know us better, and vice versa. At this stage, we would like to better understand your motivation for the role, get to know about your interests and personality, and learn about any relevant past experience or skills you might have. If this initial interview is successful, we'd then invite you to complete an assignment (

items.content:
Data Warehouse Developer

Company: Menard, Inc
Location: Eau Claire, WI 54703

The Data Warehouse Developer is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data warehouse and analytics architecture to meet the Menards business analysis and reporting needs. You will work with architects and business partners to fashion out the technical vision for applications in our Data Warehouse environment employing Teradata, Informatica, and SQL server.

SKILLS:

  • SQL
  • Teradata
  • Informatica

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Use third-party tools and in-house developed programs to develop, maintain and enhance the Data Warehouse platform
  • Conceive analytics and business intelligence platform architecture for internal Menards Team Members
  • Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders in ensuring data warehouse architecture development and utilization
  • Actively participate in developing program specifications, writing code, testing and implementing program changes and program development
  • Develop test plans and thoroughly test and debug all programs prior to implementation
  • Carry out monitoring, tuning, and database performance analysis


  • Bachelor or Associate Degree in Data Science, Data Engineering, Data Mining, Computer Science, or Computer Programming majors
  • Experience developing code, testing for quality assurance, administering RDBMS, and monitoring of database
  • Remarkable experience with technologies such as SQL Server 2008
  • Experience with Data Warehouse (particularly Teradata) and/or ETL tools (particularly Informatica) and/or Business Intelligence software desired
  • Strong analytical, consultative, and communication skills; as well as the ability to make good judgment and work with both technical and business personnel
  • Must work within designated normal office hours - Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week - at the Corporate Office in Eau Claire, WI (remote work is not offered)
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the United States, presently and in the future, without sponsorship

To Apply:

1. Submit an online application:

www.menards.com/careers

2. Email resume & unofficial transcripts to:

Amy Albers, Corporate Human Resources Coordinator

aalbers@menard-inc.com

Please complete step 1 & 2 to complete the application process

items.title: Tech Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Job description*

*The Role*
Innovify is seeking a flexible, proactive, multitasking and innovation-obsessed Technical Lead / Software Architect with interest in AI/ML.

The individual in this role must understand business priorities and demonstrate the ability to proactively anticipate needs of the leadership team. This role requires attention to detail, great organizational skills, the ability to meet tight deadlines and juggle multiple, critical requests and show flexibility and the ability to change direction at a moment’s notice. A high level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information as well as professionalism in dealing with executives inside and outside of the company is critical.

We are looking for someone with a great sense of humour to join the team who has a dedicated attitude, is customer focused, and able to handle multiple tasks with demanding work load. We love people who use their initiative and work within a team to achieve results.

Responsibilities for this position include the ability to think and plan ahead, and manage time effectively. Other key responsibilities include:
• Work both autonomously and in constant collaboration with teammates, colleagues, and external contacts.
• Collaborate with out Clients to understand their business problems and technical requirements
• Develop Software Architecture and System Architecture to meet the business objectives
• Establish End to End Technology Delivery Process and optimise continuously
• Provide High-level and detailed estimations for project planning
• Implement best practices for Software development
• Perform regular Code Reviews
• Provide technical leadership to our technical team of 50+ engineers
• Write technical blogs and promote new ideas
• Coach Agile & Lean Start-up principles.

*Requirements:*
• Bachelors degree or previous technical experience
• 3+ years’ experience of developing enterprise software across multiple stacks
• Clear evidence of innovative approaches to technology development
• Substantial experience of working in Agile teams, ideally SAFe framework
• Understanding of modern technologies, especially within AI/ML space
• Highly data-driven, with understanding of various statistical models
• Experience of leading remote technical teams
• Strong organization skills with an ability to multitask in a rapidly changing environment
• Ability to work a varied schedule based on the needs of the people or team you support
• Ability to prioritize and handle multiple assignments at any given time while maintaining commitment to deadlines
• Ability to challenge the leadership team and motivate the junior members to outperform their bests.
• Strong written, verbal, teamwork and interpersonal communication skills
• Extra bonus for being a GitHub influencer

*Preferred attributes:*
• Ability to demonstrate composure and humor under pressure. Helps co-workers thrive in stressful situations. Looks immediately for resolution to challenges.
• Takes initiative without being asked and shows a sense of urgency.
• Willing to do low profile, non-challenging work to get the work done.
• Able to function well in loosely structured situations with minimal direction.
• Effectively handles multiple projects or tasks at the same time.
• Shares information that helps others to help them do their job well. Keeps others in the loop. Fosters cross-functional and cross business teamwork. Builds and promotes team morale.
• Develops and maintains good working relationships with others. Builds trust and rapport. Practices and promotes involvement and cooperation.

*Benefits*
• Attractive salary
• ESOP for demonstrating outstanding performance
• Attractive office
• Innovative projects to work on
• Cycle to work scheme
• Pension contributions
• Season tickets loan available
• Flexible working

*How to apply:*
• Send your CV as an attachment
• Pick one of the most recent technological advancement, explain why it could be ground-breaking and what kind of solution would you develop using this technology. (0 points for picking blockchain).

*STRICTLY NO AGENCEIS*

items.content:
*Job title:* IoT & Big Data Engineer

*Location:* London, UK

*Salary:* £40,000 - £45,000 per annum (permanent or contractor)

*Closing Date:* 21 June 2018

*Starting Date:* Immediate / 02 July 2018
______

*About us*
We are OpenCapacity, a London-based startup focusing on IoT, Big Data and Intelligent Mobility Transport. Our platform is the industry’s most advanced real-time capacity forecasting solution for Public Transport. Our focus is on creating truly Intelligent Mobility by applying Machine-Learning and Artificial Intelligence in the public transport sector by generating novel capacity data and connecting this to multiple data sources from operators and cities to deliver increased productivity and an enhanced customer experience.

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a startup as they scale to multiple international markets alongside some of the most recognised players in the field of public transport. Candidates will need to demonstrate their passion in IoT sensor networks, Cloud architecture and Big Data analytics and commitment to developing clear and well-considered IoT and Big Data solutions.

*Who we are looking for*
Our *IoT & Big Data Engineer* will join a team of machine learning, web and mobile developers building the most intelligent mobility management solutions on the market.

You will be working on implementing cloud infrastructure for IoT sensors and Big Data Analytics whilst supporting the growth of our exciting products. You will have responsibility for the technical direction, planning and development of our cloud solutions.

*Essential Criteria*
* Significant experience and a proven track record in Cloud computing, IoT and Big Data systems technology architecture, development and implementations
* Hands-on experience working in agile software development in a cloud environment
* Deep technical understanding of Cloud architecture (AWS, GCP, etc.) and computing with a focus towards scalability and building & using APIs
* Demonstrated experience with one or more of Java, Python or Go.
* Advanced knowledge and demonstrated experience with NoSQL and relational databases
* Knowledge of applied Machine Learning and data analytics
* A degree in Computer Science or related field is essential

*Desirable Criteria*
* Knowledge of wireless data transfer protocols, security and data encryption protocols
* Tinkering with Computing Hardware (e.g. Raspberry Pis, Jetson TX2s) and Linux environments
* Experience with front end technologies (D3, Angular, Backbone or just vanilla JS)
* Fluency in English is essential, German knowledge would be beneficial

*Benefits*
* Working in fast-paced, cutting-edge, startup environment
* Possibility for remote working or co-working at our London based office situated in Farringdon
* Flexibly manage your own time and workflow
* Laptop of your choice
* Free fruit, tea/coffee throughout the week
* Regular networking events, mentoring events and conferences
* Exposure to experts from a number of industries
* Freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies

*Keywords:*
IoT, Wireless Sensor Networks, M2M, Cloud Computing, Data mining, Machine Learning, Intelligent Mobility, Computer Science, GPU, London

*Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent*

*Salary: £40,000.00 to £45,000.00 /year*
